bill_title: criminally prohibit the killing or harming of a police dog.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to criminally prohibit the killing or harming of a police dog. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. No person may intentionally cause the death of a police dog if the dog is engaged in law enforcement duties, or the dog is in the custody, care, or under the control of a law enforcement officer. No person may intentionally cause substantial or great bodily harm to a police dog if the dog is engaged in law enforcement duties, or the dog is in the custody, care, or under the control of a law enforcement officer. A violation of this section is a Class 1 misdemeanor. The court may also order any defendant convicted under this section to pay restitution. 500 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.021 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
